column4: Anyone know how to find out the device name of a cd/dvd drive?
dmesg | grep -i CD
dmesg | grep -i DVD
except.. it didn't work =/
trry this then: dmesg | egrep -A 10 -B 10 -i 'CD|DVD'
it will not show anything if the driver is not loaded!
find out with: lsmod | grep -i cd
hmm.. it still doesn't find my dvd drive.. odd
try: sudo modprobe cdrom
does it make a difference that I'm using a usb-connected DVD drive?
yes
you need more drivers; probably lots of usb stuff
'cdrom' module is just for IDE drives
ah.. that explains it.. thanks
usb cd drives will have names like /dev/scd0
not /dev/hdc
mm.. that's what I have for mine.. just couldn't find a way to get the device name without checking output from mount.. thought there might be a better way
not quite sure which modules you need, but they will be related to mass storage
aha, you already have the drivers then, good
this was just to find the device name to use for "readcd"
for that you can read the files in /sys/bus/usb/devices/*
not sure about that actually
probably dmesg | grep is still best
